## {{< fa box-open title="an open box" >}} Anticipated deliverable(s) {#anticipated-deliverables}

By the end of today’s workshop, you should have:

- A working draft of your traditional 1 or 2-page resume 

## {{< fa book-open title="an open book" >}} Learning objectives {#learning-objectives}

By the end of today's workshop, you should be able to:

- Format and design their resumes using Bren best practices. 
- Tailor their resumes to specific job positions, focusing on marketing their resumes for positions they want rather than positions they’ve had. 
- Explain the role of a strong resume within the overall job search process 
- Write clear, accomplishment-focused bullet points that effectively highlight their skills and impact. 

## {{< fa clipboard-list title="a clipboard with a To Do list" >}} Pre-workshop Prep {#pre-workshop-prep}

Before this workshop, please: 

### A. Upload your current resume to your shared career Box folder

Please note that we’re just looking for you to submit your current resume as-is; do not worry about editing it. 

### B. Download Microsoft Word (desktop version) 

UCSB provides Microsoft Office 365 to all current students. Visit the [UCSB-Microsoft Office 365 Resources](https://www.connect.ucsb.edu/messaging-collaboration-services/microsoft-office-365){target="_blank"} page to get started.

### C. Bring a copy of your resume 

Bring an electronic or hard copy of your current resume to edit and/or annotate during the session.
